name: Hotel Milenij

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review is a bit late coming as we stayed in the Hotel Milenij a while ago, neverthe less for what it is worth we found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. To have either breakfast, morning or afternood tea on the cafe terrace whilst watching the sun dancing on the sea is just sublime. They also have a lovely little patisserie on the side of the hotel where you can buy their cakes to take away. If you love quaint older style (romantic) hotels with a view to die for then this is for you, (just make sure you book a sea view room with balcony). If modern and state of the art is more important I wouldn't recommend it.
reviews.title: Stunning location
Lovely outdoor setting
reviews.text: We stopped by Opatija on the way to Rovijn. It is a lovely town, with wonderful Belle Epoch buildings. It is Croatia's Monte Carlo, on a smaller scale. We did not stay at this hotel, but had lunch outside. The food was fine, but the setting is what made the visit.

Spent 4 nights in this beach resort city, blessed with unusual good weather in mid October. The hotel is quite nice and well located, with an outdoor esplanade by the sea ! Lovely garden. Not to forget to try the Cafe with most tempting chocolates and freshly baked cakes ! Rooms are not outstanding but comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice hotel on seaside Opatija

reviews.text: Opatija itself is not a place I would choose to spend beach holiday as it is too crowded in the summer and although the scenery is beautiful the beaches have no sand and are just by the roads.
reviews.title: Nice and easy

reviews.title: Amazing hotel in everything!

reviews.text: We stayed here booking at the last minute (the morning of our arrival) over the Easter weekend. I was pleasantly surprised having experienced so called 5 stars in Croatia before which was not up to scratch; this is not the case in Milenij. Our room was in the new wing, very clean and well appointed. It was unfortunately partly overlooking the street which was a little noisy but this could not be avoided due to late booking. Try and book a room with a sea view. The room was very hot but we just left the window slightly ajar. We never actually complained but I'm sure the excellent staff would have assisted. We had twin beds, which yes, were soft but I enjoy this in a hotel.We did not seek to change on account of the twins so just be aware of this when booking and request a true double if you would prefer. Our package included use of swimming pool and spa (which I would imagine all deals do?) and robes and slippers were delivered to our room. Room service turned down our room on only one night with a lovely chocolate but unfortunately no water, although this is available in the minibar at a very reasonable price. Room service made up the room adequately but did not replace toiletries although again I’m sure you can request these. Penhaligon’s toiletries in the bathroom! Bathroom was fine, no natural light but a good size with double basin. I’m sure these can be requested. Hairdryer is a typical hotel hairdryer and is very poor; be prepared to bring your own or request a decent one for your use.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, the best in Opatija without a doubt

reviews.text: The highlight of the holiday was the amazing buffet breakfast, which is as good as any luxury European hotel, fresh (real) orange juice, prosecco, eggs to order, smoked salmon, good selection of fruit and muesli, different types of breads and croissants... The only drawback is perhaps that tea and coffee is also self service and not served, which is always nice in a hotel. On Easter Sunday there were so many nice touches which were impressive, painted eggs on the table, chocolate eggs to take home, frittata with fresh wild asparagus, fresh ham, sweet bread and many other delicacies.
reviews.title: we had an excellent stay at Hotel Milenij

reviews.text: We did not eat in the hotel at night, preferring to explore some of the excellent restaurants in the vicinity, some a short walk away in Volosko, other further afield by car.
reviews.title: old fashioned hotel

reviews.text: We really enjoyed the pool and sauna area which was very quiet. Fresh towels were provided, as was fresh fruit, water and tea. The outdoor Jacuzzi did not seem to be fully working some of the time. However, we were here off season, I do imagine that it gets extremely overcrowded in summer as the pool is very small, there is only one, and from what I saw the sea is accessible but you must walk down from the sun lounger area across the path to the bathing point. Therefore, beware in high season!
reviews.title: excellent hotel that earns its 5 stars

reviews.text: Staff were very courteous and friendly, multilingual, from the valet parking and bell boy to the check out. There was a slight hiccup with the bill on check out which was duly rectified and monies refunded without too much hassle.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel with stunning sea view

reviews.text: To meet the sunrise with a walk along the coastal path bordering Hotel Milenij was a privilege and a joy. To return for a sumptuous breakfast (available 0630-1100) was the reward. And that the sun shone throughout the 6-day stay during the last days of September was a bonus. The hotel has a glorious location, best experienced from its terraced restaurant, café and pool area. Inside the rooms are large and comfortable, if perhaps too traditional in design for this guest. The staff were in general helpful and polite. Cleanliness was OK, although a plastic paperclip dropped on the fitted carpet, and deliberately left, never disappeared! Toiletries were limited for a 5-star hotel and inconsistently replaced. But these were small inconveniences for the pleasure of experiencing the beauty of the view in such comfortable surroundings.
reviews.title: A privilege & a joy

reviews.text: Very pleasantly surprised by standards at this hotel. We booked through this site and got 2 nts in an economy double for £205 Inc breakfast. When we arrived we were offered either our street facing economy double or a sea facing room with a beautiful terrace but it had a sofa bed instead of a normal double. We opted for the room with the terrace and couldn't have been happier. Our room, 105, forms part of the best suite in the hotel (rooms 105-107) the view from the terrace was fabulous and the sofabed was perfectly comfortable. Really enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Very good overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After hearing a lot of compliments about Opatija and Hotel Milenij, we decided to spend holidays there. Hotel is very nice looking, rooms are big and comfortable and the food is excellent. You can choose from variety of dishes and everyone can find food they like. There is a Wellness centre in the hotel that we used each day and best compliments to staff that`s working there for their help and advice. Opatija is exactly as it was described to us, beautiful small town with "Lungo mare" sea promenade where you can walk by the beautiful sea for miles. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Lungo mare

reviews.text: Everything you should except from 5 star hotel. Rooms are cozy, comfortable and clean. In restaurant you have wide variety of food to choose from and I would like to mention spa centre for its friendly staff and calm atmosphere.
reviews.title: Luxury

description: Hotel Milenij is a 5 star luxury hotel in Opatija. An essential attribute of this property is convenience and central location in the centre of the town. Situated alongside the beautiful park and Church of St. James on the one side, and the famous Lungomare seafront promenade and the town’s Slatina beach on the other, the Milenij invites guests to enjoy enviroment where superior service and distinctive surroundings create unique experience.The Hotel is at walking distance from many attractions and the beach is only steps away.In its 99 stylish, luxuriously furnished rooms (Standard, Deluxe, Superior) and suites (Standard, Superior, Residence), the hotel offers its guests accommodation in a relaxed atmosphere with a view of Opatija’s most famous landmark– the Girl with the Seagull statue.The Wagner Caffe and Argonauti restaurant located inside the hotel Milenij are a long-time favorite among the prominent Opatija localties and socialities.In good weather, you can enjoy an aperitif or a meal outdoors on the restaurant’s and caffe’s stylish terrace across the sea with magnificant view of Kvarner Bay.During the summer time, this terrace turns into a perfect setting for a live music nights that we are hosting 5 times a week. Our uniquely designed summer program includes special music events performed by finest musicians and artists every Thursday in July and August which makes this terace probably the most ‘famous’ on Adriatic coast.Come and discover the Milenij hotel, where charm and hospitality are our trademarks.
